III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff and youth got into a physical altercation. The staff pinned
the youth and grabbed the youth by their collar bone.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via telephone on 6/4/2025.
Complainant didn’t have any additional information to share.
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
with MDHHS worker. Youth A admitted to being disrespectful to
Staff 2 by calling her a derogatory name and believed Staff 1 was
upset at him, because he was talking to Staff 2. Youth A reported
Staff 1 got up, pushed, and held Youth A up against the wall with
both hands on Youth A’s shoulder. Youth A said Staff 1 stated, “I
don’t give a fuck and don’t mind going to jail,” or losing his job and
he has his own problems. Youth A reported Staff 1 eventually let
him go, but Youth A continue to talk. Youth A said Staff 1 came
back to him and started antagonizing him again. Youth A reported
Staff 1 left the house but came back and began talking to him
again. Youth A reported they started arguing in the living room
kitchen, and dining room. Youth A stated Staff 1 hit him first and
tackled him to the couch. Staff 1 held him in a headlock and told
him to chill out. Youth A reported Law Enforcement was contacted
to assist. Youth A said there were no other youth around to
witness the altercation inside the facility, because Youth B left the
house earlier in the midst of the argument. Youth A reported
having a tiny scratch on his left wrist and chest. Youth A stated he
was offered medication attention but declined. Prior to this
incident, Youth A and Staff 1 got along fairly well. Youth A
reported Staff 2 intervened by trying to separate Youth A and Staff
1.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/27/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A had
been disrespectful toward Staff 1 throughout the day. Staff 1
instructed Youth A to leave Staff 1 alone. Staff 1 did not recall
many details from the incident but remembered it was Staff 1’s
2

last day working at the facility. Staff 1 recalled pinning Youth A
near the door and yelling at Youth A. Youth A had attempted to sit
on Staff 1’s lap, which led Staff 1 to file multiple incident reports in
the past. Although Staff 1 couldn’t remember how the physical
altercation began, Staff 1 reported Youth A had been getting
under Staff 1’s skin. Staff 1 acknowledged being aware of the
facility’s physical management policy, which prohibits staff from
physically disciplining youth. Staff 1 admitted having personal
issues and felt he had reached a breaking point. While attempting
to leave the facility, Youth A kept threatening to leave as well. On
a second attempt to exit, Staff 1 reported pinning Youth A against
the wall and bumping Youth A. Staff 1 had ongoing concerns
about Youth A’s behavior, citing previous incidents where Youth A
touched Staff 1 inappropriately, sat on Staff 1’s lap, and hugged
Staff 1 for an extended time. Staff 1 confirmed being aware that
staff are not permitted to engage in any physical contact with
youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
House with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported witnessing Staff 1
pin Youth A against the wall by his collar but is unsure how the
altercation began. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 antagonized Youth A by
saying something negative about Youth A’s mother. Staff 2
reported Youth A and Staff 1 continued to yell at one another until
Staff 1 grabbed Youth A first and they both started tussling until
Staff 1 slammed Youth A on the couch. Staff 2 reported calling
Law Enforcement for assistance. Staff 2 reported Youth A
punched the television and Staff 1 left the home and did not come
back. Staff 2 reported having no previous concerns with Staff 1.
Staff 2 reported Youth A had a scratch on his chest from the
altercation. Youth A was offered medical attention but refused.
Staff 2 reported Youth B was in his room during the altercation
and AWOL at some point during the incident, so he did not
witness the altercation. Staff 2 reported Youth B was located by
law enforcement and brought back to the building.
Staff 2 reported employees are trained in De-escalation
techniques and are supposed to utilize verbal techniques to
redirect residents. Staff 2 reported prior to this incident, Staff 1
and Youth A interactions were good and there were no concerns.
Staff 2 reported believing Youth A may have had an attraction to
Staff 1, because Youth A would always ask Staff 1 for hugs. Staff
2 also reported Youth A have asked to sit on Staff 1’s lap in the
past but Staff 1 would redirect.
3

Youth B was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
House with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported being in his room
when the argument between Youth A and Staff began. However,
he did not witness the incident due to leaving out of the side door
of the home. Youth B reported going to the park until law
enforcement brought him back. Youth B reported no concerns with
Staff 1 until the incident occurred with Youth A. Youth B reported
feeling safe within the program and reported Staff communicates
calmly to him.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
House with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she was not
present when the incident occurred, but Staff 2 contacted her via
telephone to advise of the incident. Supervisor reported Staff 1
was instructed to contact Law Enforcement. Although not
physically present, Supervisor could hear screaming and yelling in
the background, so she came to the facility. Supervisor reported
Staff 1 was not present upon her arrival at the facility. Prior to this
incident, Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary actions on file.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 was terminated and there was a plan
to press charges against him. Supervisor reported staff members
are trained to use verbal de-escalation to intervene and if this
doesn’t work, law enforcement should be contacted.
Documents Received:
Staff behavior management policy: It is the policy of the
Residential Programs not to use corporal punishment or physical
restraint. Youth Residential Services stress the importance of
attempting to employ verbal de-escalation as a first response to
physically aggressive behavior. Staff will utilize approved crisis
prevention techniques, i.e., prevention, de-escalation techniques,
escorting, and non-violent responses to assaultive behavior, which
includes a trauma-informed approach. If such efforts are
ineffective local law enforcement is contacted.
Staff personal conduct policy states that staff will not abuse or
neglect clients. Staff will not use abusive or threatening language.
Staff will not fight/assault a coworker, client or visitor.
Incident Report:
Incident report dated 06/02/2025 authored by Staff 2. This report
is consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A interviews.
Police Report #25-0009482- Police report documents Law
Enforcement (LE) response to Sumpter House on 6/4/25. LE
4

reviewed the video and determined a citation would be mailed to
Staff 1’s address on record for assault.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 06/02/25 at Sumpter House was reviewed on
06/13/25. The video begins with a view from the kitchen. Video
footage has audio. Youth A and Staff 1 are both out of camera
view but can be heard cussing at each other. Staff 2 was
observed walking in the kitchen at 6:51pm. Youth A walked in the
kitchen and shortly after Staff 1 came running in the kitchen,
grabbed Youth A by the neck area, and shoved him. Staff 1 was
observed angry and squaring up towards Youth A with his fist
balled. Staff 1 was observed yelling in Youth A’s face while Youth
A was standing still in the kitchen. Youth A walked out of the
kitchen and Staff 1 walked behind him.
Analysis This agency has been found is non compliance based on video
footage, staff and youth interviews. Upon review of video, it was
determined that Staff 1 grabbed and pushed Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/02/25, a youth and staff member engaged in a verbal
altercation. The staff member and youth continued to yell at each
other from inside/outside areas.
Investigation
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported Staff 1 stated “I don’t
give a fuck and don’t mind going to jail,” or losing his job and has
his own problems. Youth A reported Staff 1 eventually let him go,
but Youth A continue to talk. Youth A reported Staff 1 came back
to him and started antagonizing him again.
5

Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/27/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 recalled pinning
Youth A near the door and yelling at Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
House with MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 antagonized Youth A by saying something
negative about Youth A’s mother. Staff 2 reported Youth A and
Staff 2 continued to yell at one another.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face on 6/4/25 at Sumpter
House with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she was not
present when the incident occurred, but Staff 2 contacted her via
telephone to advise of the incident. Supervisor reported although
not present, she could hear screaming and yelling in the
background.
Documents Received:
Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 was terminated due to this
incident. There is no other disciplinary records on file. Staff 1
completed CPI training on 7/31/24 and 8/1/24.
Staff behavior management policy: It is the policy of the
Residential Programs do not use corporal punishment or physical
restraint. Youth Residential Services stress the importance of
attempting to employ verbal de-escalation as a first response to
physically aggressive behavior. Staff will utilize approved crisis
prevention techniques, i.e., prevention, de-escalation techniques,
escorting, and non-violent responses to assaultive behavior, which
includes a trauma-informed approach. If such efforts are
ineffective local law enforcement is contacted.
Staff personal conduct policy states that staff will not abuse or
neglect clients. Staff will not use abusive or threatening language.
Staff will not fight/assault a coworker, client or visitor.
Incident Report:
Incident report dated 06/02/2025 authored by Staff 2. This report
is consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A interviews.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 06/02/25 at Sumpter House was reviewed on
06/13/25. The video begins with a view from the kitchen. Video
footage has audio. Youth A and Staff 1 are both out of camera
view but can be heard cussing at each other. Youth A was heard
telling Staff 1 that Youth A did not say anything bad to him.
6

Youth A and Staff 1 went out of camera view and were still heard
arguing with one another. Staff 1 was observed angry and
squaring up towards Youth A with his fist balled saying "come on
bitch" to Youth A. Staff 1 was observed yelling in Youth A’s face
while Youth A was standing still in the kitchen. Staff 2 is heard
telling Youth A to go to his room. Youth A walked out of the
kitchen and Staff 1 walked behind him. Youth A walked away and
while doing so stated "you ain't worth it". Staff 1 was heard saying
"you ain't worth it little nigga" and the video footage ended.
Analysis Analysis:
The agency has been found in non-compliance based on video
footage, staff and youth interviews. Staff 1 admitted to yelling at
Youth A. Per the video, Staff 1 can be heard using derogatory
language towards Youth A. Staff 1 continued to engage and yell at
youth despite multiple opportunities to leave the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
